meanings.definition: The act of joining or attaching something to something else.
meanings.sent1: The adjunction of the two pieces created a stronger bond.
meanings.sent2: The adjunction of the keys to the keychain was necessary for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: The adjunction of the puzzle pieces was so perfect that it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an adjunction to his grumpiness, creating a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The adjunction of colors in the painting made it truly captivating.

meanings.definition: The state of being joined or attached to something else.
meanings.sent1: The adjunction of the two buildings made them look like one structure.
meanings.sent2: The adjunction of the flower to her hair completed her elegant look.
meanings.sent3: The adjunction of the cat to the dog's tail was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was an adjunction to his soul, giving him joy.
meanings.sent5: The adjunction of the stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
